text: hey folks, is it normal that a market gets closed and then reopened? I'm seeing a "Market closed" logging line, then [MarketStream: 4001] 1.179688095 removed, and then Market 1.179688095 opened 3 milliseconds later and then re-closed.

elements.text: hey folks, is it normal that a market gets closed and then reopened? I'm seeing a "Market closed" logging line, then [MarketStream: 4001] 1.179688095 removed, and then Market 1.179688095 opened 3 milliseconds later and then re-closed.

text: This seems to confuse stuff a little bit: since I bet there, the blotter sees something, but after the second one it seems to be very confused, as it tries to go over market_book.runners although there's none.

And then boom:
```File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/flumine/baseflumine.py", line 244, in _process_close_market
market.blotter.process_closed_market(event.event)

  for runner in market_book.runners:
AttributeError: 'dict' object has no attribute 'runners'```

text: You should be able to just need to fix this bug, issue is in the blotter where it is trying to update the orders with the runner status, if the raw data stream closes first then it calls the close market func and errors

text: So the recorder has created a stream and your order placing strategy has created a stream, however they share the local market object in the framework, you can see the handling for this in _processclose_market_ where the instance type is checked (recorder requires the raw update and strategy uses objects)

elements.text: So the recorder has created a stream and your order placing strategy has created a stream, however they share the local market object in the framework, you can see the handling for this in
processclose_market
where the instance type is checked (recorder requires the raw update and strategy uses objects)
